extendedIngredients.name: bell peppers
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/2 cups mixed bell peppers, stemmed, seeded, and thinly sliced

recipes.title: Dinner Tonight: Spicy Italian Sausage with Peppers Sandwich

winePairing.pairingText: Chianti, Trebbiano, and Verdicchio are my top picks for Italian. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. You could try Fonterutoli Chianti Classico. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.3 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Fonterutoli Chianti Classico
productMatches.description: Color: Deep purplish-red but bright and exceptionally concentrated.Bouquet: Extremely intense and complex with scents of cherries and raspberries accompanied by light toasty and spicy shadings.Flavor: The impact in the mouth is incisive but soft due to a substantial structure of tannins in which those that are soft and well rounded stand out. Acidity is fused with the wine's body and aids the transmission of pleasant sensations of warmth and strength. The wine features a long finish that is unusual for a regular Chianti Classico.Conclusions: Those who argue that Chianti Classico is a prickly and rough wine will change their minds after tasting this 1999, which is ready to drink now but will improve for at least five years more.Alcohol: 13.5% by volume

recipes.instructions: Procedures                                                                              1                                                                            Pour the oil into a large skillet set over medium-high heat. Add the sausages, and cook for a few minutes on each side until they are well browned. Set the sausage aside.                                                                                                                             2                                                                            Add the butter along with the red onion, bell peppers, oregano, and basil. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper. Cook for about 5 to 7 minutes, or until the onions are soft.                                                                                                                             3                                                                            Pour the wine into the skillet, add the sausage back in, cover, and turn the heat to medium low. Simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the sausages are completely cooked.                                                                                                                             4                                                                            Serve the sausages in the hoagie rolls, and top with the peppers.

steps.step: Pour the oil into a large skillet set over medium-high heat.
Add the sausages, and cook for a few minutes on each side until they are well browned. Set the sausage aside.
Add the butter along with the red onion, bell peppers, oregano, and basil. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper. Cook for about 5 to 7 minutes, or until the onions are soft.
Pour the wine into the skillet, add the sausage back in, cover, and turn the heat to medium low. Simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the sausages are completely cooked.
Serve the sausages in the hoagie rolls, and top with the peppers.
